titleStmt.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, January 25, 1900

bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
No. 44, Consular.
Legation of the United States,
Monrovia Liberia;
Jan. 25, 1900.

Hon. David J. Hill,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington.

I have the honor to say, that the present session of the Liberian Legislature, in order, to prevent smuggling; and the better to secure the collection of import duties, has enacted a law, for the erection and establishment of bonded warehouses, in every port of entry.

Prior to this; much visiting steamers, while they lay in port; purchasing from and trading with the crews thereof, without an honest payment of the import duties.
duties.

I have the honor to
be your obedient servant,
Owen L. W. Smith,
M. R. and C. General.
